item.title: Untangling WebDriver and the Browser Automation Landscape I Live In
item.description: I define WebDriver, W3C WebDriver, Selenium, geckodriver, FirefoxDriver, Marionette harness/runner/client/driver and more.

item.title: A Week of Reflection and Programming for Fun
item.description: Returning to Recurse Center for a week inspires me to reflect on my experience at their retreat 2 years go.

item.title: Database Migrations (“You know nothing, Version Control.”)

item.title: Open Source Bridge 2014
item.description: Open Source Bridge 2014 was my first conference experience in about 5 years and my first non-academic conference. It had a great mix of talks and was thoughtfully organized and super friendly. I learned about Firefox quality assurance, communication strategies, remote work, discrimination in the tech industry and being a …
item.dc:creator: Maja Frydrychowicz

item.title: “One and Done” comes to Open Source Bridge 2014!
item.description: As part of Open Source Bridge 2014, I’ll be at the Hacker Lounge to show people how to use One and Done to get started with contributions to Mozilla, as well as help interested developers set up an development environment so they can contribute new features to the One and Done tool.
item.dc:creator: Maja Frydrychowicz

item.title: Project Management at Mozilla
item.description: How One and Done uses Github pull requests and bugs in Bugzilla.
item.dc:creator: Maja Frydrychowicz

item.title: Working Remotely is… Hard? Different? Strange?
item.description: My internship with Mozilla involves work within a team whose members are located around the world and not where I am. Some are Mozilla employees or maybe contractors, some are interns like me, some might be volunteers. The key point is that it’s not just me with my mentor …
item.dc:creator: Maja Frydrychowicz

item.title: Dive In! Applying to the FOSS Outreach Program for Women
item.description: I got an internship with Mozilla through GNOME’s Outreach Program for Women (!). The application process alone taught me a lot about open source contributions and the community around them.
item.dc:creator: Maja Frydrychowicz
